newsitem.title: USA: Husky Oil files for $500 mln in notes/debentures.
newsitem.headline: Husky Oil files for $500 mln in notes/debentures.

text.p: Husky Oil Ltd said Thursday it filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up $500 million in senior notes and senior debentures.
The Canadian company, headquartered in Calary, Alberta, said one set of senior notes is due 2003, another 2006 and the senior debentures are due 2016.
Husky said the securities are being offered as part of an overall recapitalization of the company.
The offering will be made through BT Securities Corp, CIBC Wood Gundy Securities Corp, Goldman Sachs & Co, HSBC Securities Inc, Merrill Lynch & Co and J.P. Morgan & Co.
The company said it does not intend to apply for listing of the securities on any national securities exchanges or for quotation of the securities through an automated quotation system.
The proceeds from the recapitalization are estimated to be $982.6 million, including gross proceeds of the offering estimated to be $682.6 million, the filing said.
Proceeds will be used for repayment of existing term credit facilities, repayment of loans and general corporate purposes, the filing said.

Husky is an integrated oil and gas company and its equities securities are privately held. Li Ka-Shing and trusts for members of his family indirectly hold 46 percent of the voting securities of the company, the filing said.
Hutchison Whampoa Ltd indirectly holds 49 percent of the voting securities and Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce indirectly holds five percent, the filing said.
